intro: Rhododendron watsonii, commonly known as the Chinese rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of China. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are leathery and elliptical, providing a dense canopy that supports various wildlife. Rhododendron watsonii thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters.
